translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The twentieth section
The discussion of deeds
“Are all deeds fixed?”
“Yes.”
“Are they fixed by wrong view?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Are they fixed by right view?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽natthi aniyato rāsīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  na atthi aniyataḥ rāsi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “No.”🔽“Is there no indeterminate category?”🔽“No.”
“Isn’t there an indeterminate category?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi aniyato rāsi, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi aniyataḥ rāsi no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you shouldn’t say that all deeds are fixed.”
“Are all deeds fixed?”
“Yes.”
“Haven’t three categories been stated by the Blessed One:

analyzed: rāsi sammatta niyataḥ rāsi aniyataḥ rāsi iti
translated: the category fixed by wrong view, the category fixed by right view, and the indeterminate category?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci tayo rāsī vuttā bhagavatā—🔽“micchattaniyato rāsi, sammattaniyato rāsi, aniyato rāsi”, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci tayoḥ rāsī vuttā bhagavatā  rāsi sammatta niyataḥ rāsi aniyataḥ rāsi no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you shouldn’t say that all deeds are fixed.”

analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam kammam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya ṭṭhena niyatanti
translated: “Is a deed to be experienced in the here-&-now fixed in the sense of being to be experienced in the here-&-now?”
“Yes.”
“Is it fixed by wrong view?”
“You shouldn’t say that …
“Is it right to say that it’s definite in the sense of being definite as rightness?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  upapajja vedanīyam kammam pe
translated: “You shouldn’t say that …🔽“Is it right to say that kamma to be experienced in a future life …

analyzed: apara apariya vedanīyam kammaṃ apara apariya vedanīya ṭṭhena niyatanti
translated: kamma to be experienced in some future life is definite in the sense of being definite as some future life?”
“Yes.”
“Is it right to say that it’s definite in the sense of being definite as wrongness?”
“You shouldn’t say that …

analyzed: sammatta niyatanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is it right to say that it’s definite in the sense of being definite as rightness?”🔽“You shouldn’t say that …
“It shouldn’t be said that🔽kamma to be experienced in this very life is definite in the sense of being definite as this very life,

original: diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṭṭhena niyataṁ, upapajjavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ …pe…
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam kammam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya aṭṭhena niyate upapajja vedanīyam kammam pe
translated: kamma to be experienced in a future life …

analyzed: apara apariya vedanīyam kammaṃ apara apariya vedanīya ṭṭhena niyatanti
translated: kamma to be experienced in some future life is definite in the sense of being definite as some future life.”

original: Āmantā.🔽Diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ upapajjavedanīyaṁ hoti, aparāpariyavedanīyaṁ hoti …pe…🔽upapajjavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṁ hoti, aparāpariyavedanīyaṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam kammam upapajja vedanīyam hoti apara apariya vedanīyam hoti pe  upapajja vedanīyam kammam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam hoti apara apariya vedanīyam hoti pe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Is it right to say that kamma to be experienced in this very life is kamma to be experienced in a future life or kamma to be experienced in some future life? …🔽kamma to be experienced in a future life …

original: aparāpariyavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṁ hoti, upapajjavedanīyaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: apara apariya vedanīyam kammam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam hoti upapajja vedanīyam hoti iti
translated: kamma to be experienced in some future life is kamma to be experienced in this very life or kamma to be experienced in a future life?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe.🔽Tena hi diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṭṭhena niyataṁ, upapajjavedanīyaṁ kammaṁ …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe  tena hi diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam kammam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya ṭṭhena niyate upapajja vedanīyam kammam pe
translated: “That can’t be said.”

analyzed: apara apariya vedanīyam kammaṃ apara apariya vedanīya ṭṭhena niyatanti
translated: “Then is kamma to be experienced here & now fixed in terms of being kamma to be experienced here & now? Is kamma to be experienced on rebirth fixed in terms of being kamma to be experienced on rebirth? Is kamma to be experienced in some subsequent life fixed in terms of being kamma to be experienced in some subsequent life?”
“The Discussion of Kamma is finished.
The twenty-first sub-chapter on the Monastic Law is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Sāsanaṁ navaṁ kataṁ atthi koci tathāgatassa sāsanaṁ navaṁ karoti labbhā tathāgatassa
analyzed: sāsanam navam katam atthi koci tathāgatassa sāsanam navam karoti labbhā tathāgatassa
translated: The dispensation, new, there is, someone, the Tathāgata’s dispensation, new, is made, it’s possible, the Tathāgata’s

original: sāsanaṁ puna navaṁ kātuṁ, puthujjano tedhātukehi kammehi avivitto, atthi kiñci saṁyojanaṁ
analyzed: sāsanam puna navam kātu puthujjanaḥ tedhātukehi kammehi a vivittaḥ atthi kiñci sayojana
translated: dispensation, to make new again, an ordinary person, not separated from the three realms, there is, any fetter,

original: appahāya arahattappatti, atthi adhippāyiddhi buddhānaṁ vā sāvakānaṁ vā, atthi buddhānaṁ
analyzed: a pahāya arahatta ppatti atthi buddhānam vā sāvakānam vā atthi
translated: not abandoned, the attainment of worthiness, there is, the psychic power of intention, of the Awakened Ones or their disciples, there is, the Awakened Ones,

original: buddhehi hīnātirekatā, sabbā disā buddhā tiṭṭhanti, sabbe dhammā niyatā, sabbe kammā niyatāti.
analyzed: buddhehi hīna atireka tā sabbāḥ disāḥ buddhāḥ tiṭṭhanti sabbe dhammāḥ niyatā sabbe kammāḥ niyatā ati
translated: with the Awakened Ones, inferiority, superiority, the Awakened Ones stand in all directions, all dhammas are fixed, all kamma is fixed.”
